definition: to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with

sentences.english: He is only teasing. Don't take it so seriously.
sentences.chinese: 他不过是戏弄而已，别太当回事儿。

sentences.english: Damn this man, he teases me.
She grew cross and wearisome, snapping at and teasing Catherine continually.
sentences.chinese: 她变得别扭而且消沉，常常叱骂和戏弄凯瑟琳。

sentences.english: It jumped up and down disrespectfully, mocking the hunting soldiers. It threw a nut at them.
sentences.chinese: 它无礼地上窜下跳，戏弄士兵们，还朝他们扔果核。

sentences.english: Pay no attention to him, he's hectoring upon you.
The next day, I was totally expecting to be teased again.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，我完全预料着自己会被再次戏弄。

sentences.english: The ironic thing about anger is that the joke is on the angry person.
sentences.chinese: 而怒火却总是戏弄着正在生气的人，这真的很讽刺。

sentences.english: It was mean of you to tease the little boy.
sentences.chinese: 戏弄那个小男孩，你真坏。

sentences.english: I do not banter you, I am in earnest.
sentences.chinese: 戏弄他人而使其失去理性是无礼的。

sentences.english: Don't hoax the new boy who's my nephew.
sentences.chinese: 别戏弄新来的小伙子啊，他是我外甥。

sentences.english: I live for laughing and teasing and I have never met a stranger.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢欢笑和戏弄，而且我从来没有遇见过陌生人。

sentences.english: And what other group could we taunt without fear of retribution?
sentences.chinese: 还有哪些人我们可以嘲笑戏弄，不用害怕遭到报应？

sentences.english: Her brother always teased her before he obeyed and I stood by the railings looking at her.
sentences.chinese: 她的弟弟总喜欢在听话之前戏弄她一番。

sentences.english: "Hail, king of the Jews!" they said.
sentences.chinese: 跪在他面前戏弄他说，恭喜犹太人的王阿。

sentences.english: I don’t dare to tease him because he has absolutely no sense of humor.
sentences.chinese: 我不敢戏弄他，因为他根本没有幽默感。

definition: to play with/to engage in/to resort to/to dally with
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to take liberties with a woman/to dally/to assail a woman with obscenities
to taunt/to ridicule/to jeer at/to treat coldly/to abandon
to play with/to toy with/to dally with/to engage in/to resort to
to make a fool out of/to fool/to dupe
to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
practical joke/prank/to play a practical joke
